name: Closed Change, Natural to Reverse

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: Although the amount of turn is given as 'nil', a very slight turn to R may be made.

feet positions: RF to side and slightly back

precede: 4-6 Natural Turn (after Back Lock or Progressive Chasse to R
Outside Spin (taken after Open Impetus and Cross Hesitation making a full turn to end facing DC

name: Closed Change, Reverse to Natural

feet positions: RF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: Although the amount of turn is given as 'nil', a very slight turn to L may be made.

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back

precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (at corner, after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)
4-6 Reverse Turn after underturned Outside Spin

name: Natural Turn
follow: 1-3 Natural Turn then Outside Change (turning 1/8 to L)

name: Reverse Turn
precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (after underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)
Fallaway Reverse and Slip Pivot (at corner)
follow: Progressive Chasse to R (after 4-6 Reverse Turn ended DC after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus
Closed or Open Telemark (after 4-6 Reverse Turn ended DC after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note:
The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact
            with the floor.

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note:
The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact
            with the floor.

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note:
The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact
            with the floor.

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note:
The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact
            with the floor.

name: Whisk

feet positions: RF to side and slightly fwd
LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: The position of step 2 is consistent with step 2 of a Closed Change.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP
lady.note: The feet complete the turn between 1-2.

precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (at corner after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)
follow: Weave from PP (steps 1-2 moving to centre after Whisk turned to face DC, or steps 1-2 moving DC after Whisk turned to face LOD)
Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

name: Whisk (at corner)

feet positions: RF diag fwd R side leading
LF crosses behind RF in PP
RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (at corner after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)
follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

name: Whisk (end Facing DC)

feet positions: RF diag fwd R side leading
LF crosses behind RF in PP
RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (at corner after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)
follow: Weave from PP (steps 1-2 moving to centre)

name: Whisk (end Facing LOD)

feet positions: RF to side and slightly fwd
LF crosses behind RF in PP
RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: 4-6 Reverse Turn (at corner after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus)

feet positions: RF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF to side and slightly fwd
LF to side and slightly fwd
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
RF to side and slightly back
RF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF to side and slightly fwd
LF to side and slightly fwd
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
RF to side and slightly back

name: Closed Impetus

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF

precede: Reverse Corte (turning 1/2 to end backing DW after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus at side of room)
Cross Hesitation (turned to L to back DW)

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF

name: Closed Impetus (commenced backing DW)

feet positions: LF to side and slightly back
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF

precede: Reverse Corte (turning 1/2 to end backing DW after Underturned Natural Spin Turn or Closed Impetus at side of room)
Cross Hesitation (turned to L to back DW)

feet positions: RF to side small step (heel pull)
LF closes to RF without weight
RF closes to LF without weight

name: Hesitation Change (at corner to end facing DW of new LOD)

feet positions: RF to side small step (heel pull)
LF closes to RF without weight
RF closes to LF without weight

name: Hesitation Change (at corner to end facing new LOD)

feet positions: RF to side small step (heel pull)
LF closes to RF without weight
RF closes to LF without weight

name: Hesitation Change (at corner to end facing DC of new LOD)

feet positions: RF to side small step (heel pull)
LF closes to RF without weight
RF closes to LF without weight

name: Outside Change

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back

precede: Progressive Chasse to R (end backing DC)

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back

name: Outside Change (end in PP)

feet positions: RF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP

precede: Progressive Chasse to R (end backing DC)

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the man.

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

name: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn to end backing DW)

feet positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the man.

follow: Back Whisk (1/4 turn end facing DC)

name: Back Whisk

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

name: Back Whisk (1/4 turn)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

name: Back Whisk (at corner)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

name: Back Whisk (end facing DC)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Weave from PP (steps 1-2 moving to centre)

name: Back Whisk (1/4 turn at corner)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

name: Back Whisk (1/4 turn end facing DC)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Weave from PP (steps 1-2 moving to centre)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

name: Back Whisk (3/8 turn end facing DC)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Weave from PP (steps 1-2 moving to centre)

name: Back Whisk (3/8 turn at corner)

feet positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Chasse from PP (moving DC to follow with Closed Wing)

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back
lady.note: More advanced lady dancers may, if they wish, use ball of foot to whole foot on step 1 of this figure.

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back
lady.note: More advanced lady dancers may, if they wish, use ball of foot to whole foot on step 1 of this figure.

name: Basic Weave (commenced backing LOD at corner)

feet positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: It is better to commence facing LOD for the 3 steps of the Reverse Turn preceding this figure.

feet positions: RF to side and slightly back
lady.note: More advanced lady dancers may, if they wish, use ball of foot to whole foot on step 1 of this figure.
